name: 楊元森
objective: Parallel computing techniques change as computing technology rapidly develops and evolves. In this semester, Spring 2015, this course explains how to create high-performance, scalable, reliable systems, exposing the design principles, architecture, and innovative applications of parallel, distributed, and cloud computing systems, as well as the Internet of Things.
schedule:
W01: History and impacts of high-performance computing
W02 ~ 05: Review of programming engineering problems
W06 ~ 08: Distributed system models
W09: Midterm (either close or open book, or take home) 
W11 ~ 12: Computer clusters for scalable parallel computing
W13: Proposal presentation 
W14 ~ 15: Virtual machines and virtualization 
W16 ~ 17: Basic of cloud computing and Internet of things
W18: Final presentation
scorePolicy:
Midterm (programming) 30% +/- 5%
Proposal presentation 15% +/- 5%
Final presentation and report 40% +/- 5%
Misc. 15% +/- 5%
materials:
1. Hwang, K., Dongarra, J., & Fox, G. C. (2013). Distributed and cloud computing: from parallel processing to the internet of things. Morgan Kaufmann.
2. Grama, A. (Ed.). (2003). Introduction to parallel computing. Pearson Education.
